intro: Claoxylon australe var. laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered claoxylon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal and sandy soils. Its botanical features include yellowish-green stems and a distinct floral structure with cupular inflorescences. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
